title: In Education Battles, Republicans See a Winning Campaign Issue
sub_head: GOP leaders say a victory in Virginia shows the power of ‘parents’ rights’ to draw voters
body:
Emboldened by elections on Tuesday that were swayed by hotly debated education issues, Republican leaders are already planning to inject schools into next year’s midterm House and Senate campaigns.
The Republican victory in Virginia’s election for governor is proving particularly influential to party strategists who believe that Glenn Youngkin, a political newcomer, won the Democratic-leaning state in large part by arguing that parents had been shut out of decisions on race in the curriculum, Covid-19 precautions and academic standards.
